meanings.definition: A genre of science fiction that typically features steam-powered machinery and Victorian-era aesthetics.
meanings.sent1: The movie we watched last night was a thrilling steampunk adventure set in a world of steam-powered machines.
meanings.sent2: Many authors enjoy writing stories in the steampunk genre, combining futuristic technology with Victorian style.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, Sarah showed up dressed as a steampunk character with gears and goggles galore.
meanings.sent4: The cityscape transformed into a steampunk wonderland as the sun set, casting shadows on the metallic structures.
meanings.sent5: In the steampunk world, time seems to stand still as the clanking of gears fills the air.

meanings.definition: A person who is a fan of or participates in the steampunk subculture.
meanings.sent1: As a dedicated steampunk, Mark spends hours crafting intricate costumes and accessories for conventions.
meanings.sent2: The steampunk community is known for its creativity and passion for all things retro-futuristic.
meanings.sent3: When asked about his hobby, Tom proudly declared himself a steampunk enthusiast, much to his friends' amusement.
meanings.sent4: She was a true steampunk at heart, always finding beauty in the fusion of past and future aesthetics.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the convention, one could spot steampunks of all ages, each adding their unique touch to the subculture.
